p: M is the other antigenic protein of PEDv, and the most abundant component of the viral envelope (Utiger et al. 1995). In contrast to S, M is more conserved, showing 5.5% the number of mutations as S after 100 serial passages (Chen et al. 2014; Sato et al. 2011). The use of a protein that remains stable is important for subunit vaccine design to ensure that a vaccine can be used for a wide variety of strains and locations. The M protein of TGEV and SARS-CoV show virus-neutralizing activity in the presence of complement, the component of the immune system that enhances the ability of antibodies to clear pathogens. This virus-neutralizing activity was demonstrated to be higher or comparable to the neutralizing capacity of 8 individual S protein fragments (Pang et al. 2004; Woods et al. 1988).
